sub_title: Great things can be accomplished in impossible circumstances, be flexible, be diligent and maintain your sense of humor.
summary:
Highly strategic, energetic and inspirational leader, possessing extensive career success devising leading strategies, company structures, operational design and budget control to attain leading market share. Possessing global expertise, launching innovative business solutions across complex developing markets, able to utilise in-depth regulatory / compliance expertise to minimize risks and achieve financial results through effective operational / financial modelling. Inspirational team manager, experienced in leading on / offshore teams through engaging development plans to achieve operational excellence. Adept managing from bottom to C Level stakeholder relations through effective influencing skills. Through data driven approach, able to utilise key insights to formulate leading business decisions and drive change management initiatives. 

Possessing varied leadership expertise, with a hands-on approach, now looking to utilise wealth of experience within new Director challenge.

Specialities: Thought Leadership, Business Strategies, Technical Management, Director, P&L Management, Budget Management, Operational Management, Risk Management, Corporate Governance, Data Analysis, Data Quality, Data Insights, Business Analysis, Action Plans, Risk Management, Programme Management, Project Management, Agile, DevOps, AML, FDA, HIPAA, CCPA, AVG, Team Management, OffShore Team Management, Training, Team Development, Infrastructure Design, Stakeholder Management, Performance Improvement, Relationship Management, Quality Management, Grant Applications

school.name: University of Michigan - Stephen M. Ross School of Business

company.name: Médecins Sans Frontières/Doctors Without Borders (MSF) Eastern Africa

profile_positions.company: Médecins Sans Frontières/Doctors Without Borders (MSF) Eastern Africa
profile_positions.description: People think it’s a bit crazy to walk voluntarily into a war zone. I think as a human, it is impossible to stay away at a time of such massive need to stay away when you have the skill set to help one human being. Being this close, how did I not go? And here I go again. Mostly what I bring is my heart and experience, and as much anesthesia and antibiotics that I can get my hands on. Stand with Ukraine.
profile_positions.title: Medical Warrior

company.name: American Institute of Minimally-Invasive Heart Surgery, AIMHS

profile_positions.company: American Institute of Minimally-Invasive Heart Surgery, AIMHS
profile_positions.description:
Joined at point of pioneering development of minimally invasive heart surgery technique to craft innovative business strategies and devise business plan to launch and manage surgery training and methodology coaching to global Heart Surgeons in partnership with Managing Director, Dr. Chaudhry. Create and define forecasted financial models. Research, plan and target global market opportunities. Continually evaluate financial health in line with future prospects. Manage multiple projects and maximize budgets. Conceive and manage multiple grant applications. Lead financial control within constantly changing landscape through thought leadership approach.

	Build effective stakeholder relations with MD, Executive and client Board Members to provide targeted strategies and business advice on global expansion, market opportunities and risk management
	Research and analyse global market opportunities, writing grant applications to expand heart surgery technique offering across all socioeconomic classes
	Conceive operational infrastructure across global locations, building key University relations to create joint partnerships with leading institutions aligned with innovative medical advancements
	Devised innovative training platform showcasing Dr Chaudhry’s ground breaking surgical technique, creating library content available to any Heart Surgeon at nil cost, meeting strategic objective within budget
	Identified lack of heart surgery training, care and equipment within under developed countries, to successfully launch training operations in Karachi, Pakistan and achieve multiple Surgeons development in just 6 months
	Devised new operational model, financial footprint and infrastructure in Pakistan, successfully copying and adopting model across country, minimizing heart disease within largest facility
	Achieved first heart transplant surgery procedure in Pakistan in just 7 months following launch, attaining highest Civilian country award available to Dr Chaudhry
profile_positions.title: Chief Operating Officer

profile_positions.description:
Delivered executive leadership across sales, client solutions, relationship and resource management across Europe and UK. Devised, launched and managed GDPR operational strategies to comply with new GDPR (AVG) regulations. Led as new privacy regulations / GDPR subject matter expert across Australia, Japan and California (CCPA) territories. 

	Delivered thought leadership to analyse new data protection laws, implementing innovative approaches to comply with new regulations
	Conceived possible risks, scenarios and implications of UK Brexit on business performance, devising innovative DevOps models to adhere to new legislation compliance
	Partnered with large global automaker client to conceive cross branded sales and interactive buying experience through UK pilot programme across existing Cloudera environment, creating data collection processes to gain key insights to formulate cost effective target marketing within new privacy legislation
	Achieved “New Partner of the Year” Award for performance excellence
	Won initial bid of £9.6M for new iKnow and Pitney Bowes brand contract relations
	Created, designed model and hired new Data Science team for global home consumer client, successfully resolving traffic flow store problems caused by adverse weather, catalogue releases and floor stock locations
	Devised new graph database, working with IBM, for Norwegian Tax Authority, attaining €26M revenue stream
profile_positions.title: Executive Vice President

profile_positions.description:
Led strategic delivery and management of the European Analytics & Information Management Practice (Headcount c400) to laterally, win 500M USD deal, and be promoted to drive operational control of 3rd largest Pharmaceutical company (Headcount +2600) and AIM Practice across global territories.

	Created sales and client retention strategies to increase margin by 56% from -4% at role commencement, the highest profitability rate seen to date
	Inspired, developed and drove exceptional performance across fluctuating teams (200 – 400 headcount) whilst doubling overall revenue streams
	Increased customer satisfaction rating fro a 2 to a 9 over 2 year period
	Simplified licensing and product ranges, decreasing licensing redundancy costs by €3M in just 6 months
	Researched and led impact analysis to devise simplified operating landscapes, eliminating redundant software product ranges
	Instilled Six Sigma/Agile  methodologies across leading Show Retailer, Lighting and Heath Tech clients, leading multiple on and offshore teams to achieve compliance across entire enterprise landscape through Agile mythology and DevOps model implementation
	Devised complex programme strategy and architecture (re-architecture of TeraData and new implementation of DB2} of regulatory complaint MDM implementations in just 14 weeks (fastest ever timescale) with only 40 within on / offshore team
profile_positions.title: Director

profile_positions.description:
As strategic IBM Partner, led and trained multiple on / offshore Development teams delivering migration, architecture, ETL, reporting, DQ and DG framework projects to key client deliverables across Six Sigma, Agile and DevOps methodologies. Conceived cost analysis and risk assessments of non-compliance. Executed strategic plans to meet client deliverables and attain change management. Managed projects from inception to completion.

	Successfully implemented regulatory/compliance requirements across platforms and programmes
	Built effective government agencies relationships, handling P&L to meet agreed revenue targets
	Executed action plans, identifying testing process and success matrix gaps to effectively mitigate risks
	Devised, documented and instilled new testing protocols through DevOps for managed services
	Created solutions for Fin/Serv regarding AML
profile_positions.title: Senior Technical Architect

profile_positions.description:
Devised and launched key strategies to deliver pandemic readiness programme across rural and nomadic African countries. Identified need to reduce response times for aid resources (staff, antidotes & equipment) to devise innovative action plans and procedures to mitigate time delays. Managed cost controls. Devised new processes to meet legal compliance, HIPAA privacy standards, FDA regulations and ad hoc local regulations across consistently changing landscape. 

	Built key relations across multiple language speakers (169 in Zimbabwe alone) through multiple complexities
	Consistently altered delivery plans across changing regulatory requirements and constant team rotation (30,60 and 90-day tours), volatile safety threats, inconsistent connectivity and equipment theft
	Created consistent, secure, compliant and accurate data across immunizations delivery to enable supply chain management during a catastrophic event whilst minimizing costs and global impact
profile_positions.title: Senior Program Director

profile_positions.description: Retained as key talent across multiple promotions to lead enterprise level solution services across data integration, warehousing, governance, profiling and data cleansing for multiple client accounts. Adapted, and mastered new products as they were acquired by IBM, learning to intertwine more IBM products in overall solutions for customers. Met compliance regulations across numerous global countries. Measured success through KPI and success metrics. Drove change management initiatives through data driven analytics approaches. Devised innovative data governance policies to attain regulatory compliance and reduce fines, achieving >6M cost savings over 3 years.
profile_positions.title: Director Professional Services-ASG

volunteer_experiences.description:
Organizing out Outreach Program for the Benelux region for both local involvement and coordination with our colleagues in India.
We are really focused on the betterment of the lives of children in impoverished areas of India, giving back in whatever way we can make the greatest impact. Including but not limited to, providing teachers, extra curricular activities, educational supplies, mentoring, nutrition, and caring about these young lives.
Locally, we will organize events to give back to the communities that we live and work in. Including using the skills we are best at... technology! We are hoping to use our keen analytical skills to help some NGO's to improve the services that they offer. In collaboration with DataKind.org, we hope to make a data driven difference. We also are looking for other ideas to give back to charitable agencies in Benelux. Please contact me with ideas!

Deliver as strategic advisor to Dr. Naidoo, Secretary General of Amnesty International (ret). Devise, launch and lead opportunity development for new NGO, focused on achieving systemic racial equality. Vet key industry relationships for published book / cooking TV show collaboration. Collate, analyse and report key analytics / demographics to form strategic decisions. Lead contract and key University collaboration negotiations to attain budget targets. Lead new website creation and financial control to exceptional standards within hands on position.

DigitalConscience.org is the foundation behind all of our charitable efforts. Although we were often not born in our new countries, and we may not speak the local language, we are indeed members of our communities, and want to use our unique skills to give back in a meaningful, and impactful way. We want to contribute to the betterment of our world. We have a digital conscience, do you?

We are a group of volunteer data scientists that perform free analytics for non-profit organizations to help them discover how to use their funding to help more people. Need our help? Please contact us!!!

It was stunning to us that in a small country like the Netherlands, nearly 4 million residents are digitally illiterate. This has a devastating impact to our community because it makes it difficult to access services, receive communication, and complete financial requirements. We believe that everyone needs basic skills to enrich their lives. This is what we do!!!

In order for a community to become digital, ALL of its members need to be able to have basic internet skills. We volunteer our time with our local Senior residents, to work with them, one on one, to learn how to access the internet, use social media to connect to loved ones and friends, use online applications, and use a laptop and iPads.
